contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox scientist | name = Guillaume Antoine Olivier | image = Olivier Guillaume Antoine 1756-1814.png | image_size = | alt = | caption = Guillaume Antoine Olivier | birth_date = {{birth date|1756|1|19|df=y}} | birth_place = | death_date = {{death date|1814|10|1|df=y}} | death_place = | residence = France | citizenship = {{FRA}} | nationality = [[France|French]] | ethnicity = | fields = {{Unbulleted list|[[Entomology]]}} | workplaces = | alma_mater = }} '''Guillaume-Antoine Olivier''' (19 January 1756, [[Toulon]] – 1 October 1814, [[Lyon]]) was a [[France|French]] [[entomologist]]. He was the author of ''Entomologie, ou histoire naturelle des Insectes'' (1808) and ''Le Voyage dans l'Empire Othoman, l'Égypte et la Perse'' (1807). He was a close friend of [[Johan Christian Fabricius]] and a patron of [[Pierre André Latreille]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.unl.edu/museum/research/entomology/workers/GOlivier.htm |title=Guillaume Olivier 1756–1814 |publisher=[[University of Nebraska–Lincoln]] |accessdate=October 2, 2010}}</ref> [[Image:Olivier.jpg|left|thumb|''Entomologie, ou histoire naturelle des Insectes'']] He studied medicine in [[Montpellier]], where he became good friends with [[Pierre Marie Auguste Broussonet]]. With [[Jean Guillaume Bruguière]] and [[Jean-Baptiste Lamarck]], he collaborated in the creation of ''Journal d'Histoire Naturelle'' (1792). Afterwards, he served as a naturalist on a 6-year scientific journey that took him to [[Asia Minor]], [[Persia]], [[Egypt]], [[Cyprus]] and [[Corfu]]. He returned to France in 1798 with a large collection of natural history specimens from his travels. Later, he was associated with the ''[[École nationale vétérinaire d'Alfort]]'', where in 1811, he was appointed professor of [[zoology]].<ref>[http://plants.jstor.org/person/bm000006163 JSTOR Global Plants] (biography)</ref> Today, most of his collection is housed at the [[Museum National d'Histoire Naturelle]] in Paris.<ref>[http://museum.unl.edu/research/entomology/workers/GOlivier.htm University of Nebraska-Lincoln State Museum - Division of Entomology] (biographical information)</ref> ==References== {{commons category|Guillaume-Antoine Olivier}} {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=69044142}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Olivier, Guillaume-Antoine | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = French entomologist | DATE OF BIRTH = 19 January 1756 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Toulon | DATE OF DEATH = 1 October 1814 | PLACE OF DEATH = Lyon }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Olivier, Guillaume-Antoine}} [[Category:1756 births]] [[Category:1814 deaths]] [[Category:French entomologists]] [[Category:French carcinologists]] [[Category:French arachnologists]] [[Category:People from Toulon]] [[Category:Members of the French Academy of Sciences]] {{France-zoologist-stub}} {{Entomologist-stub}}
